channel.title: Runescape classic graphics
channel.description:
Hello,
I have two questions about the rsc graphics:
1: Does anyone seem to know what they were made in? I believe rs2 was done in some autodesk software and would it be safe to say it is the same for rsc?
2: For the walls of rsc (for example the stone walls) we all know it is just a picture. My question is as follows, is there a model for a flat rectangle that the picture is "glued" onto or is the graphic of the wall just displayed some how (coding)?
Thanks

item.title: Runescape classic graphics
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

The picture of the walls are textures, not the object itself, I believe the walls indeed have an object for them, I haven’t researched this bit of the client though.

Read full topic
